}} 'TCF Bank Stadium', sometimes referred to as either "'The Bank'" or "'The
Gopher Hole'," is the football stadium for the Minnesota Golden Gophers college
football team at the University of Minnesota in Minneapolis, Minnesota. The
50,805 seat on-campus "horseshoe" style stadium is designed to support future
expansion to seat up to 80,000 people, and it cost $303.3 million to build.

TCF Bank Stadium is the first of three spectator sports stadiums that either
have been built or are being developed for the major tenants of the Hubert H.
Humphrey Metrodome â the Gophers and two professional teams, the Minnesota Twins
baseball and Minnesota Vikings football teams.
Served by light rail (both the Hiawatha Line and eventually the Central
Corridor), the three stadiums are located within a radius loosely centered at
the Guthrie Theater on the Mississippi River in downtown Minneapolis.
